meanings.definition: An introduction to a book or other literary work.
meanings.sent1: The prefaces in books give readers a glimpse of what to expect.
meanings.sent2: I always read the prefaces of novels to understand the author's perspective.
meanings.sent3: The prefaces in cookbooks sometimes make me hungry before I even start cooking.
meanings.sent4: Her prefaces to each chapter were like opening a door to a new world.
meanings.sent5: The prefaces of fairy tales often set the tone for the entire story.

meanings.sent1: She always prefaces her presentations with a brief overview of the topic.
meanings.sent2: The professor likes to preface his lectures with interesting anecdotes.
meanings.sent3: He prefaces every joke with a big smile to make it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The CEO prefaces every decision with thorough research and analysis.
meanings.sent5: Before starting the meeting, she prefaces the agenda to keep everyone informed.
